meanings.definition: A person who is regarded as disloyal or treacherous.
meanings.sent1: I can't trust those ratfinks to keep a secret.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends turned against him, calling him a ratfinks.
meanings.sent3: The ratfinks in the movie always try to sabotage the hero's plans.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a ratfinks when she revealed her friend's secret.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the ratfinks lurking in the shadows, waiting to deceive you.

meanings.definition: To inform on someone; betray them.
meanings.sent1: He decided to ratfinks on his accomplice to avoid punishment.
meanings.sent2: She promised not to ratfinks on her classmates during the test.
meanings.sent3: The spy had to ratfinks on his own team to save himself.
meanings.sent4: Betrayal stings like a sharp knife when you ratfinks on a friend.
meanings.sent5: The witness chose to ratfinks on the criminal, leading to his capture.
